page.title: 02COLE COURT, HAROLD HILL
page.content: {Cole Court} was built in 1985 as sheltered accommodation for elderly people. There are thirty-four flats each with a kitchen, bedroom, living room and bathroom. There is one flat with two bedrooms. Two flats are specially equipped for the physically disabled. A guest room for the relatives who have travelled over 50 miles is also provided. Each flat is fitted with a special emergency alarm. When the warden has a week-end off these alarms are switched to a mobile unit in Romford. A public telephone is available but residents may have their own 'phones installed for Â£80. A washing room is provided with two washing machines and tumble-driers together with ironing boards and irons but most residents to do their own washing in their own flats. The full rent of a flat is Â£30.90p .
